channel.title: Getting Started on Imageless Thought
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Imageless Thought

item.title: AI: A Primer
item.description: The AI field is heavy with jargon and terminology. To help you navigate and understand the the technologies and solutions that are out there, you will need a some help. I suggest starting by reading this article: Artificial Intelligence Glossary: Neural Networks and Other Terms Explained - New York Times; March 23, 2023. Below are links to some glossaries and articles to further assist you with the terminology. Glossaries of AI Terminology: AI Blog provides a searchable database of terms.

item.title: Windows Subsystem For Linux
item.description: Over the past two years years Microsoft has made some significant improvements to the Windows Subsystem for Linux. The Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) is a feature of the Windows operating system that enables you to run a Linux file system, along with Linux command-line tools and GUI apps, directly on Windows, alongside your traditional Windows desktop and apps. WSL 2 is a new version of the Windows Subsystem for Linux architecture, available beginning with Windows 10-Version 1903-Build 18362, that powers the Windows Subsystem for Linux to run ELF64 (Executable and Linkable Format) Linux binaries on Windows.
